entry.title: OP: Get notifications from the controller instead of the list view
entry.content:
Call `message_center_utils::GetSortedNotificationsWithOwnView` from

the new `NotificationCenterController` and send these to the center

view which will route it to the appropriate list view.



Overloaded `NotificationCenterView` and `NotificationListView`'s `Init`

functions so they can receive notification lists as a parameter when

`NotificationCenterController` is used.



Needed for the Ongoing process project in order to send multiple

notification lists to the two separate lists that will exist: pinned +

non-pinned.



go/ongoing-processes-dd

entry.title: Revert "Improve handling of notification actions in App Shims."
entry.content:
This reverts commit bded16d6f8c78ff9d93294ee85864dfac49f1389.



Reason for revert:

[tree gardener]

causes AppShim failures on Mac OS bots.

- AppShimListenerBrowserTest.LaunchNormal

- AppShimListenerBrowserTest.LaunchRegisterOnly



Here are the four failing bots, with links to the first failure in each bot:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac11%20Tests/24223/overview

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac12%20Tests/15992/overview

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac13%20Tests/7990/overview

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac13%20Tests/7990/overview



Failures are timeouts such as

---

app_shim_listener_browsertest_mac.mm(229): Failed

RunLoop::Run() timed out. Timeout set at ProxyRunTestOnMainThreadLoop@content/public/test/browser_test_base.cc:853.

---



Original change's description:

> Improve handling of notification actions in App Shims.

>

> Notification actions should be able to notify the browser process

> even if the browser process hasn't tried to connect to the

> notification service in the app shim process yet. Additionally,

> if an app shim is launched by the OS to handle a notification

> action, we need to make sure to install a UNUserNotificationCenter

> delegate before the launch finishes.

>

> To make this possible, this CL splits out what used to all be in

> the constructor of MacNotificationServiceUN to now have separate

> construction, mojo-bind and RequestPermission calls. This allows

> app shims to create the service on startup, while only binding its

> receiver and requesting permission when the browser process asks

> for this.

>

> Also uses a single MacNotificationServiceUN instance for the lifetime

> of the app shim, routing notification actions through a mojo pipe

> that is setup on initial connection with the browser process, rather

> than using the action handler mojo pipe that is passed when the

> browser process connects to the notification service.

>

> Low-Coverage-Reason: TESTS_IN_SEPARATE_CL To test this, a bit more functionality needs to be in place first. Tests will be added once that is in place.

> Bug: 938661

> Change-Id: I412339d762873137cb97256d055abe3f9bb44399

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5078729

> Reviewed-by: Robert Sesek

> Commit-Queue: Marijn Kruisselbrink

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1246050}



Bug: 938661

Change-Id: I42d1f09b374352e5408bfafbaa872c962d69da35

entry.title: Fix HTML directionality inheritance for empty <bdi> elements with no dir attribute.
entry.content:
This correctly initializes the flag indicating that the HTML

directionality is inherited from the parent for elements, which

behaves like it has dir=auto by default. Even without this change, it

gets initialized correctly when a dir attribute is changed or when the

text content of the element changes.



This also clears the same flag when the dir attribute changes. This

should affect some other cases of dir attribute changes, but we somehow

didn't hit it until fixing the previous bug exposed the problem.



This fixes the failure of a test that I added in

https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/pull/43896 in response to

noticing and fixing an error I made in the HTML spec in

https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/10005 .



Bug: 576815

entry.title: [Extensions] Add schema support for required non-trailing functions
entry.content:
When support was added to the schema compiler for functions as a

PropertyType back in 2012 [1], it never added logic for required inner

function parameters (as trailing required function parameters got

treated slightly differently as being "callbacks"). This meant that a

required inner function parameter would actually lead to a compile error

with an unused variable in the generated cc file.



This CL adds in support for this case simply by added a generated check

that the value is preset as expected when required. It also adds a test

and a bit more information in a comment to help the next person trying

to understand this.



[1] https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/10824002/



Bug: N/A

entry.title: Switch to a parse result structure for video codec string parsing.
entry.content:
We'll be adding additional fields like bit depth and chroma sub

sampling in the future, so convert video codec string parsing

to use a parse result structure instead of individual output

pointers.



This is a no-op change. Some other minor cleanups are included:

* Switched to std::string_view in updated methods.

* Switched all interop points around levels to VideoCodecLevel.

* Parsing is moved out from behind build flags, there's no reason

to conflate parsing with support checks.

entry.title: [DNR] Add matching logic for url pattern response header rules
entry.content:
Add matching for response header conditions inside RequestParams and

integrate into RulesetMatcherBase (and derivatives) and RulesetMatcher.



A single ExtensionUrlPatternIndexMatcher (UM) and RegexRulesMatcher (RM)

will contain both onBeforeRequest rules and onHeadersReceived rules,

and a new method: GetOnHeadersReceivedAction, will match against

the latter set of rules (which match against response headers)



While this approach results in more code, the alternative approach of

constructing a new UM and RM just for onHeadersReceived rules results

in more objects and less flexibility in case rules matched in the

onBeforeRequest stage will need to influence rule matches in the

onHeadersReceived stage.



Bug: 1141166

Change-Id: Iabd42a6e5801976c4e3de26dc77dc810ea3da49a

entry.title: editor: make sure quick answer / mahi show when editor is absent
entry.content:
Currently, there is a bug that when editor is disabled in the settings page after being enabled for a while, then quick answer is also disabled even in the context where quick answer should be enabled, for example, in read-only (non-editable) text fields.



In close investigation, CopyEditor will always take precedence over quick answer if the orca flag is enabled.



This CL changes the logic to enable/disable editor. Instead of simply relying on the flag boolean values, it sends a mojom request to the backend to see if copyeditor should appear or should be blocked. This makes the process become asynchronous.



Bug: b:312592767

entry.title: Revert "Make sure LOG(FATAL) variants always die"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 14000bb6b6e71447b4f6e050344dd668836e8453.



Reason for revert:

LUCI Bisection has identified this change as the cause of a test failure. See the analysis: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/bisection/test-analysis/b/5670216841297920



Sample build with failed test: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8759161030609675297

Affected test(s):

[ninja://base:base_unittests/LoggingTest.NestedLogAssertHandlers](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja:%2F%2Fbase:base_unittests%2FLoggingTest.NestedLogAssertHandlers?q=VHash%3A7108cf45ef6d0ffa)



If this is a false positive, please report it at http://b.corp.google.com/createIssue?component=1199205&description=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fci.chromium.org%2Fui%2Fp%2Fchromium%2Fbisection%2Ftest-analysis%2Fb%2F5670216841297920&format=PLAIN&priority=P3&title=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F5171452&type=BUG



Original change's description:

> Make sure LOG(FATAL) variants always die

>

> This does not make DFATAL always die (which it shouldn't, matching absl

> logging behavior), nor does it tell the compiler that LOG(FATAL) is

> [[noreturn]] yet. We're not ready for that (dead-code warnings).

>

entry.title: Revert "Reland "[Private Network Access] Add location update WPTs""
entry.content:
This reverts commit 9623791019276f3620cbee0caa4fb4d4688d5089.



Reason for revert:

After this landed, there have been consistent failures in on the "Linux Tests (dbg)(1)" bot, starting from

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Tests%20(dbg)(1)/118066/test-results



Mostly these failures are because the expected text is:

---

[FAIL] private to local: failure.

assert_equals: expected "timeout" but got "success"

---

and the actual text is:

---

[FAIL] local to local: no preflight required.

assert_equals: expected "success" but got "timeout"

---



If this is the correct output text for that input, the expected output text needs to be updated.

If this is not the correct output text for that input, that indicates a bug somewhere.





Original change's description:

> Reland "[Private Network Access] Add location update WPTs"

>

> This is a reland of commit 31efd97d0500638a16198610ad5b1ea383175558

>

> The timeouts have been extended to 10 seconds which was proved to be

> effective on resolving flakiness in https://crbug.com/1507761.

>

> Original change's description:

> > [Private Network Access] Add location update WPTs

> >

> > Similar to window-open and anchor tests but navigating via

> > window.location updates. The "top.location" tests update

> > the window.location of its top window.

> >

> > Bug: 1431155

> > Change-Id: I0894d798d40cd20bc4bc66042132feeb98a6beab

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5062770

> > Commit-Queue: Jonathan Hao

> > Reviewed-by: Yifan Luo

> > Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1232002}

entry.title: Revert "[QuickStart] Account creation"
entry.content:
This reverts commit dfaa98913e021e3e5cce1b59dcf8c1787550073c.



Reason for revert:

[tree gardener]

In the change where this landed, both the

"Linux Chromium OS ASan LSan Tests (1)" and "linux-chromeos-dbg" bots started failing in

DeviceLocalAccountTest.TermsOfServiceWithLocaleSwitch



first failing runs:

- https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Chromium%20OS%20ASan%20LSan%20Tests%20(1)/55615/test-results

- https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-chromeos-dbg/35304/test-results



Failure relates to the login / OOBE code for ChromeOS. This is the only change on the blamelist that touches relevant code. Thus, while I didn't repro to see if this fixes the error, I'm confident enough to move ahead to get the tree to turn green.



Failure is long (follow links above); looks like a failed assert, here's the key line I think:

>

[thread_pool_impl.cc(502)] Check failed: transaction.traits().thread_policy_set_explicitly(). A ThreadPolicy must be specified in the TaskTraits of an UpdateableSequencedTaskRunner whose priority is increased from BEST_EFFORT. See ThreadPolicy documentation.

entry.title: Remove synchronous callback from ChromeHttpAuthHandler.
entry.content:
Previously, calling LoginHandlerAndroid::BuildViewImpl could result in

synchronous destruction of LoginHandlerAndroid. This made it difficult

to reason about and write correct code. This CL forces callbacks from

Java to go through a PostTask, making destruction asynchronous. This

should have no user-visible effect.



This CL makes some minor cleanups to ChromeHttpAuthHandler to accurately

reflect invariants.



Low-Coverage-Reason: COVERAGE_UNDERREPORTED

Change-Id: Iaf24ed9f9d2982dffcafeb2028b7585610d30658

Bug: 1516256

entry.title: Add automated mount error function to odfsConfigPrivate extension API
entry.content:
If the automated flow, done by the ODFS extension fails, it should

trigger a notification to inform the user about the failure. This CL

adds the extension API and implements it for Ash and Lacros.

On Ash, the extension API implementation can directly call the

Ash-side implementation. On Lacros, the notification is triggered

through a new crosapi interface.

The core implementation has to be done on the Ash side as the

notification shows a "Sign in" button which on click will call the

`RequestODFSMount` function. The sha1 files correspond to the uploaded

notification images following the translation process

(https://g.co/chrome/translation).



API spec: go/enterpriseclippy-extension-api

entry.title: Clear last element under mouse from the Event Handler.
entry.content:
When scrollbars get destroyed by PLSA::DestroyScrollbar the EventManager

class might still have a reference to the destroyed scrollbar. This

CL makes sure the reference is updated when the scrollbar is destroyed

so that no unintended calls to the destroyed scrollbar happen.



This was discovered when fixing tests that break when Fluent scrollbars

are enabled. The event manager was calling the Fluent scrollbar theme,

which checked the CSS property of a destroyed scrollbar and crashed in

the web test `scrollbars/custom-scrollbar-drag.html`



More details in the linked bug.



Bug: 1517340

move forward with fixing the bug for now and investigating infra issues

at a later point if necessary. This test is failing because the factory

which instantiates `deviceSwitcherResult` wasn't initialized in the

TestChromeBrowserState. This CL initializes this factory.

entry.title: [Read Aloud] Fix duplicate text issue.
entry.content:
crrev.com/c/5178843 accidentally introduced a bug where we stopped

considering the nodes in the current granularity when checking for

previously spoken nodes, which resulted in occasional duplicate speech.



This CL fixes that bug. I think this is preferable to the code before

crrev.com/c/5178843 because referencing the current granularity is

little simpler than managing a separate vector of ids that need to

be updated and cleared.

entry.title: [ImprovedDownloadWarnings] Show toast for discard dangerous
entry.content:
We currently show a "toast" notification when the user removes an item

(or clears all items) from chrome://downloads. This CL adds a similar

toast for discarding a dangerous file.



Modifies the strings on the toast in consultation with UXW. There are

two variants of the string. One of them applies to files that are

completely on disk, and indicates to the user that deleting the file

from download history still keeps the actual file on disk.



The undo behavior is the same as before: Undoing deletion of normal

files is possible, but dangerous and insecure files are removed directly

without a chance to undo.



Also adds a CSS variable to allow customizing the width of the toast

because the added string may be too long for the default width.



Screenshots:

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1YurMbHeYKZ29sllLGVOGmGCvd0O2GY47

entry.title: Don't open Chrome when launching a PWA on Mac.
entry.content:
Matching other platforms, this keeps Chrome hidden when launching a

PWA. Quitting Chrome still closes all PWAs, which also matches other

platforms.



While Chrome is running in background mode it will not keep itself

alive, so closing the app shim will automatically cause the (hidden)

chrome process to also quit. The OS takes care of switching Chrome

from background mode to a "regular" application if some window is

opened, or if the user tries to launch Chrome while it is running

in background mode (at which point Chrome will start keeping itself

alive again, even if all windows are closed).



Low-Coverage-Reason: COVERAGE_UNDERREPORTED browser_tests on Mac are not run on the CQ

Low-Coverage-Reason: HARD_TO_TEST the behavior here is specifically about interactions with the OS

entry.title: media/base: Change VideoFrame file descriptor access
entry.content:
DMA buffer-backed VideoFrames provide access to the DMA buffer file

descriptors as a means of providing access to the underlying frame data.

This changes file descriptor access from accessing a reference to a

vector to accessing the individual elements.



New accessors NumDmabufFds() and GetDmabufFd() provide the tools for

users to access file descriptors. All consumers of the previous method,

DmabufFds(), have been changed to use the new accessors.



Since all usage of DuplicateFDs has been removed, remove that function

and the scopedfd_helper files.

entry.title: [FaceGaze] Use screen bounds and add debug visualization
entry.content:
Uses screen bounds instead of hard-coded bounds when setting

the mouse position. Ensures screen bounds and mouse position

are set before processing frames, and ensures tests wait for

initialization step. Previously if mouse position was not changed

by a user moving a physical mouse/trackpad, the mouseLocation_

would be undefined, which meant the ! caused a failure in

updateMouseLocation. We cannot expect FaceGaze users to move

the physical mouse after FaceGaze has started up, so we must

force a mouse move to get mouse location set.

entry.title: [dPWA] Refactoring commands to remove all re-entry.
entry.content:
This change takes a set of norms that all commands have needed to

follow to maintain safety and bakes them directly into the command

system, allowing a lot of code deletion and making a variety of UAF /

reentry bugs impossible.



Specifically, this:

- Puts the base::Value::Dict directly into the command, instead of

having the command implement ToDebugValue(), which caused UAFs in

the past. This includes elevating the debug value in the 'jobs' as

well.

- Removes the OnShutdown method, and instead has the shutdown args be

provided on construction & saved in the command base class.

- Stores the callback directly into the command, guaranteeing that it

is called after the command is complete.

- Upgrades the callback commands to always provide the lock & the

debug value, allowing the 'result' value to be returned by the

callback.

- Fixes a bugs where commands scheduled before Start now have their

scheduled location saved correctly.

- Correctly reports success in command

CheckIsolatedWebAppBundleInstallabilityCommand (note that this value

isn't used for anything yet, so this is essentially a no-op change.)



Some changes required to make this work correctly:

- InstallFromInfo needed to be split into two commands to accommodate

the 'replace' version needing a different callback type. The replace

version seems only to be used by tests, so that can eventually be

deleted, but to keep this patch from exploding more I simply created

two different commands here.

- WebAppUninstallCommand can't accept a job if that job also needs the

debug value from the command. So it was refactored to construct the

jobs internally, and have explicit static naming to specify which

type of uninstall command it is.



Low-Coverage-Reason: LARGE_SCALE_REFACTOR

Change-Id: I167ed6c7d6c310b459afd15877f3dc5ff719fd71

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5105100

Reviewed-by: Dibyajyoti Pal

Reviewed-by: Alex Ilin

Reviewed-by: Alan Cutter

Commit-Queue: Daniel Murphy

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1246051}

entry.title: Improve handling of notification actions in App Shims.
entry.content:
Notification actions should be able to notify the browser process

even if the browser process hasn't tried to connect to the

notification service in the app shim process yet. Additionally,

if an app shim is launched by the OS to handle a notification

action, we need to make sure to install a UNUserNotificationCenter

delegate before the launch finishes.



To make this possible, this CL splits out what used to all be in

the constructor of MacNotificationServiceUN to now have separate

construction, mojo-bind and RequestPermission calls. This allows

app shims to create the service on startup, while only binding its

receiver and requesting permission when the browser process asks

for this.



Also uses a single MacNotificationServiceUN instance for the lifetime

of the app shim, routing notification actions through a mojo pipe

that is setup on initial connection with the browser process, rather

than using the action handler mojo pipe that is passed when the

browser process connects to the notification service.



Low-Coverage-Reason: TESTS_IN_SEPARATE_CL To test this, a bit more functionality needs to be in place first. Tests will be added once that is in place.

Bug: 938661

Change-Id: I412339d762873137cb97256d055abe3f9bb44399

entry.title: iwa: Create a separate Manager for IWA policy
entry.content:
As it was discussed in [1] we should create a separate manager for

enterprise policy installed IWAs.

In this CL we just aim to establish the IsolatedWebAppPolicyManager.



This CL aims to keep the changes to the logic as little as possible to

make subsequent CL conceptually simpler. To do that we:

- renamed the old IsolatedWebAppPolicyManager to BulkIwaInstaller;

- extracted the IWA logic from the WebAppPolicyManager to the newly

created IsolatedWebAppPolicyManager.



No new functionality was added.



In its current state the IsolatedWebAppPolicyManager can do one time

installation of the IWAs in the Managed Guest Session.



[1] https://chromium-review.git.corp.google.com/c/chromium/src/+/4529139/comment/69454f4c_70b49e85/

entry.title: [Android] CachedFlag does not search for instance to set test override
entry.content:
Previously, some CachedFlags has legacy shared preference keys that were

not generated by a KeyPrefix, so we needed to search the list of

existing CachedFlags to find if it was ones of those when setting test

overrides (which are keyed by the shared preferences key).



After crbug.com/1446352 got fixed, all keys are now generated by the

prefix and we can sever this dependency from CachedFlag to

ChromeFeatureList to prepare it to be moved to //base.

entry.title: Increase max frame count in observeScrolling helper.
entry.content:
When threaded compositing is disabled, frames are not tied to vsync and

may pump more quickly (at intervals as short as 1ms, see task posted in

WebTestWebFrameWidgetImpl::ScheduleAnimationInternal).



This means the test may observe more than 500 frames before the end of a

smooth scroll, when running under run_web_tests.py on Chromium bots.

entry.title: [AsyncSB] Pass navigation_id into CreateURLLoaderThrottles
entry.content:
This info will eventually be used to implement

AsyncCheckTracker::IsMainPageLoadPending[1]. We will add navigation_id

in security_interstitials::UnsafeResource and use it to determine

whether DidFinishNavigation has been called and whether we should

show a post commit error. The navigation_id is needed to map

UnsafeResource back to the original navigation that triggered this Safe

Browsing check.



This CL only bubbles up navigation_id to the embedder layer without

actual usage. The actual usage will be done in the following sequence:

1) Inject navigation_id into safe_browsing/ layer:

https://crrev.com/c/5171128.

2) Consume the navigation_id in safe_browsing::AsyncCheckTracker:

https://crrev.com/c/5171302.



More context in http://shortn/_92fIErC6tC (google only).



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/safe_browsing/content/browser/async_check_tracker.cc;l=35;drc=e71b6befbb758f58280989b2a83b583a7394fe06

entry.title: extract local image color after prefs are set
entry.content:
This is an attempt at fixing an issue where the iframe for the NTP

background image isn't being updated sometimes for local images. The

theory here is that it has something to do with Theme being updated at

the same time by both the background being updated and color being

updated. To mitigate this, color extraction has been moved to after

prefs have been updated and observers have been notified of the new

background, which is how it works for non-local images and historical

wallpaper search images.



Note: This bug is very hard to reproduce on my machine so I can't tell

from testing locally if it works well. After it is up in Canary, I can

tell better on my Windows machine, since it can reliably reproduce.



Bug: b/315321480

entry.title: Revert "[iOS] Delay keyboardAccessoryView initialization in Omnibox Coordinator"
entry.content:
This reverts commit bc7ecb87e40982456e6e45d11ef4c4b9a2fb8eba.



Reason for revert: This was a proof of concept CL to test latency changes. We should revert this CL and create appropriate changes. For example: not using self within a callback and instead use a weak pointer/weak ptr factory. looking into not adding a delay and instead delaying instantiation until it's needed.



Original change's description:

> [iOS] Delay keyboardAccessoryView initialization in Omnibox Coordinator

>

> We found that the keyboardAccessoryView was being initialized at startup

> which adds (according to Instruments) ~31ms to startup latency. This CL

> delays this initialization until after startup since we don't need the

> keyboard accessory view until we receive a user action on an omnibox.

> Doing this will improve startup latency and should be a noop from a user

> perspective.

>

> Bug: 1515588

>

> Change-Id: I98e086bb4182c55f730e9cdc32a2f0e5706c67c6

entry.content:
Popping the tpcd component installer into the component layer so that this can be used

by more embedders than chrome.

The loader isn't being executed without the flag being enabled so currently not hit by any tests.



I've added this optionally to WebView behind a switch but it won't actually do anything at this time

since the tpcd service is in //chrome/browser/tpcd.

That seems like a good follow up at some point.



WebView is in an interesting space where 3PCs are already disabled by default so there may

be some exploration worth doing in the future around supporting this metadata.

Added to this is that Android developers can re-enable 3PCs if they wish

so there are questions around how we can motivate developers to potentially

_not_ need to re-enable 3PCs.



I tested that this will get as far as setting the tpcd metadata in WebView when enabled.



Low-Coverage-Reason: LARGE_SCALE_REFACTOR

implements either `BuildServiceInstanceForBrowserContext` or

this CL replaces it by the first one.



This also ensures that, instead of applying `WrapUnique` to a `new` raw

entry.title: Make PA's NoDestructor compatible with trivially destructible types.
entry.content:
There are some types which are only trivially destructible on certain

platforms, e.g. std::mutex. The current prohibition makes it rather

annoying to use NoDestructor with such a type.



Making NoDestructor constexpr also allows the constinit qualifier to be

used with NoDestructor when the type is trivially destructible, avoiding

the need to use a wrapper function at all.



Change-Id: Ifc6b6f44bd9a0bd57ac09fe43c5625cb90c06134

entry.title: Implement ControlledFrameContextMenusCreateFunction
entry.content:
This change adds an internal API handler for

ControlledFrame.contextMenus.create() which will set an instance of a

ControlledFrameMenuIconLoader in MenuManager so that the IWA's icon is

loaded properly for context menus added to tags.



This change also removes checks in MenuManager and ContextMenuMatcher

which skip the icon loading if Extension* is null.



Design doc:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1rR7r2sm8UKi3UnxybouiPVRuvHtBnFt1fQGxRvWE06w



Bug: 1233993, b/312767560



Low-Coverage-Reason: COVERAGE_UNDERREPORTED

The low coverage is reported for

controlled_frame_extensions_renderer_api_provider.cc and controlled_frame_internal_api.cc, however these are tested by

controlled_frame_apitest.cc, since it requires the JS sources to be

loaded properly and it exercises the internal API.
